You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### findBlackPixel 
from collections import defaultdict   # --- py stmt 1
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 2
def f_gold(picture: List[List[str]], target: int) -> int:   # --- py stmt 3
    m, n = len(picture), len(picture[0])   # --- py stmt 4
    rows = [0] * m   # --- py stmt 5
    cols = defaultdict(list)   # --- py stmt 6
    for i in range(m):   # --- py stmt 7
        for j in range(n):   # --- py stmt 8
            if picture[i][j] == 'B':   # --- py stmt 9
                rows[i] += 1   # --- py stmt 10
                cols[j].append(i)   # --- py stmt 11
    t = [[False] * m for _ in range(m)]   # --- py stmt 12
    for i in range(m):   # --- py stmt 13
        for k in range(i, m):   # --- py stmt 14
            if i == k:   # --- py stmt 15
                t[i][k] = True   # --- py stmt 16
            else:   # --- py stmt 17
                t[i][k] = all([picture[i][j] == picture[k][j] for j in range(n)])   # --- py stmt 18
            t[k][i] = t[i][k]   # --- py stmt 19
    res = 0   # --- py stmt 20
    for i in range(m):   # --- py stmt 21
        if rows[i] == target:   # --- py stmt 22
            for j in range(n):   # --- py stmt 23
                if len(cols[j]) == target and all([t[i][k] for k in cols[j]]):   # --- py stmt 24
                    res += 1   # --- py stmt 25
    return res   # --- py stmt 26
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function countMatchingSubarrays(picture, target) {   // --- py stmt 3
  var numRows = picture.length;   // --- py stmt 4
  var numCols = picture[0].length;   // --- py stmt 4
  var rowCounts = Array(numRows).fill(0);   // --- py stmt 5
  var colIndices = new Map();   // --- py stmt 6
  for (var i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {   // --- py stmt 7
    for (var j = 0; j < numCols; j++) {   // --- py stmt 8
      if (picture[i][j] == 'B') {   // --- py stmt 9
        rowCounts[i] += 1   // --- py stmt 10
        if (colIndices.has(j)) {   // --- py stmt 11
          colIndices.get(j).push(i);   // --- py stmt 11
        } else {
          colIndices.set(j, [i]);   // --- py stmt 11
        }
      }
    }
  }
  var isMatching = Array(numRows).fill(0).map(() => Array(numRows).fill(false));   // --- py stmt 12
  for (var i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {   // --- py stmt 13
    for (var k = i; k < numRows; k++) {   // --- py stmt 14
      if (i == k) {   // --- py stmt 15
        isMatching[i][k] = true;   // --- py stmt 16
      } else {   // --- py stmt 17
        isMatching[i][k] = true;   // --- py stmt 18
        for (var j = 0; j < numCols; j++) {   // --- py stmt 18
          if (picture[i][j] != picture[k][j]) {   // --- py stmt 18
            isMatching[i][k] = false;   // --- py stmt 18
            break;   // --- py stmt 18
          }
        }
      }
      isMatching[k][i] = isMatching[i][k];   // --- py stmt 19
    }
  }
  var numMatches = 0;   // --- py stmt 20
  for (var i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {   // --- py stmt 21
    if (rowCounts[i] == target) {   // --- py stmt 22
      for (var j = 0; j < numCols; j++) {   // --- py stmt 23
        if (colIndices.get(j) && colIndices.get(j).length == target && colIndices.get(j).every(k => isMatching[i][k])) {   // --- py stmt 24
          numMatches += 1;   // --- py stmt 25
        }
      }
    }
  }
  return numMatches;   // --- py stmt 26
}
```
